Blog.post: To cheer you from your beds, because it is almost morning, have the first three verses of urlLink The Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam , in the stonking first translation of Edward FitzGerald: I AWAKE! for Morning in the Bowl of Night Hath flung the Stone that puts the Stars to Flight: And Lo! the Hunter of the East hath caught The Sultan's Turret in a Noose of Light. II Dreaming when Dawn's Left Hand was in the Sky I heard a Voice within the Tavern cry, "Awake, my Little ones, and fill the Cup Before Life's Liquor in its Cup be dry." III And, as the Cock crew, those who stood before The Tavern shouted--"Open then the Door! You know how little while we have to stay, And, once departed, may return no more." (If this sounds familiar but you don't know why, you probably have heard the most famous stanza: Here with a Loaf of Bread beneath the Bough, A Flask of Wine, a Book of Verse--and Thou Beside me singing in the Wilderness-- And Wilderness is Paradise enow.) ...anyway it's a great poem, all about getting drunk, carpe diem -ing and not fussing about any afterlife bollocks or any of that.. There's some weird stuff about Jesus that Mr FitzGerald saw fit to shoehorn in, but ignore that.

No picture today, just a Useful Tip . When cooking home-made meatballs, do not fry them. Instead, lay them on a baking tray and bung them in the oven. When they're done, add them to the pan of sauce so they can sort of marinade in it for a bit, to prevent their being dry. This has 2 benefits: 1. You use less oil if you bake them, which is Healthy. 2. They won't fall apart in the frying pan, which makes you look Less Inept.

Only one mind, because they are a bit huge, and I don't want you feeling sick or not eating all your dinner.

When I first came across urlLink LUSH I got very excited and thought they were quite the bee's knees. Then I tried out a few products that were a bit disappointing, and got miffed, and stopped shopping there very much. They've brought out tons of new stuff since then, though, and when I popped back in I realised some of it is really jolly good, so here are my recommendations for "falling-back-in-love-with-LUSH" stuff. Arabian Bright hair mask - smells wonderful and spicy, makes your hair shiny. Only for brunettes and needs washing out thoroughly. Pied De Pepper foot cream - also spicy, and so nice that just after putting it on, someone once asked me what my wonderful perfume was...! Skinny Dip shower gel - I sometimes go to the bathroom and open the bottle just for a sniff - I love cloves, and white chocolate, and violets, and this has all three, which is a result. Buffy the Backside Slayer - you need one of these. Aqua Mirabilis - more for special occasions, it's a really good rose-smelling exfoliating thingie. Ceridwen's Cauldron "bath melt" - so, SO good. Ignore the bath ballistics that make your skin itch, go for this instead even though it's pricy. Strawberry boat shower treatment - also for special occasions, but WOW does it make your bum go smooth. And it really smells like just-picked strawberries, a bit grassy and green. Tisty tosty - it is a bath ballistic but this one doesn't make my skin itch, and it's got ickle roses in. Neither does Rainbow Worrier , and that's rather nice too. Writing the above down makes me wonder if I am not slightly obsessed with spice and rose smells, and exfoliating/moisturising products. But there you have it. Avoid the moisturisers and cleansers, and the bath bars which create extraordinary amounts of suds, and the funny-coloured ballistics which will stain your bath, and the deodorants that don't work. And have a picture of a tiger in a bath, too, which I sent to the Lush times (they didn't use it).
urlLink So that's what economists do all day...
I'M A GEENIYUS!
urlLink Oh yeah. They also have Minipuds, of which the white chocolate and passionfruit truffle is just outrageously scrumptious, and tiny too so you can feel (relatively) virtuous.

HELlo OH that is a nice picture of me IT looks like it really happened I Donot know the differnces between English and american trains I know theyboth run on tracks is that right ALL in all it is a very nice train So thank you for putting me on it did you know they do not allow other cats on trains That is the law and that is what I am telling the other cat only I can go on them if I had my way I would go all the way to france or maybe texas your friend ABBIE ...isn't that just lovely?! Made me really pleased. :D

I bought some new shoes today from urlLink New Look - they are all pinky and round-toed, and they made me happy. They were only £30 though, which makes me thing sweatshops... but look at the website! New Look has an urlLink Ethical Policy (it's in the menu bar at the top) that forbids the recruitment of manufacturing workers under 15 years of age, and insists on decent wages and hours. I knew urlLink H&M and urlLink IKEA did similar, but they're Swedish. Go and have a look, it's rather cheering.

Right, let's have another bash at the old Top Tips thing. Today's topic is: Nail Varnish . DO NOT buy nail varnish from Nails Inc, as it chips and peels very easily. DITTO Maybelline and Clarins - it never dries and it's all gunky. DO buy nail varnish from Rimmel if you are skint as it's very good although it won't keep long. ALWAYS use a base coat or your nails will go yellow. This is especially true with dark polishes. REMEMBER to lay off the paint for a few days each week so the vitamin D can get to your nails and make them strong. Eat lots of oily fish and spinach and stuff if your nails are weak. BEWARE of dark nail varnishes - they are lovely and vampy for evening but very aging to your hands in bright daylight. NEVER wear pale nail varnishes on your toes, because your feet will look ill. Ignore anyone who says your hands and feet should match as they probably vote Tory. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES should you attempt to wear blue, yellow or green nail varnish. This is for the under-15s and goth boys only. Black can be okay sometimes though. No, honestly, it can look very stylish. And finally: the best brands are urlLink Chanel , which does absolutely the prettiest, most flattering colours and urlLink OPI , which has the best texture and keeps for ages. You can get cheap OPI varnishes on urlLink Ebay : in the shops it's about £7-£8, on ebay you shouldn't pay more than £4.
urlLink Just click it. It'll do your heart good, I promise. (Needs sound, obviously)

I'm instigating another (hopefully) regular event, today, and it is LITERARY CORNER . Who knows, I might even make picture-logos and things, and add search facilities so you can find them all and stuff. I doubt it, but all things are possible (in the best of all possible worlds) Today's book is urlLink The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, by Mark Haddon . It's written from the point of view of a boy with Asperger's and it brilliantly recreates his skewed-logical thought processes. All the characters are beautifully drawn and treated with respect however mad or silly they are, and in all it is a book so moving you would cry whether the ending was happy or sad, although I'm not telling you which it is.
I am Cher! I am Courtney Cox! I am ANGELINA JOLIE! urlLink Who are you? Digital camera or scanner required, sorry

It's time to welcome this week's GUEST CAT! This fearsome beast is Roxy, named for Roxy Hart in the musical Chicago. They are both bewitchingly attractive and apparently harmless, yet both are also cold-blooded murderesses. She is owned by Sam, who shares a house with Rory. Roxy likes laminate flooring and in her idle moments ponders the forthcoming age of World Domination for cats.
Q. What's black and white, and red all over? A. A badger in a bathful of strawberry jelly!
Hawey baby, let's GO!
urlLink Hooray for clothes!

Hurrah for another Literary Corner! Today's book is urlLink Astonishing Splashes of Colour, by Claire Morall . This too has been out for ages in paperback - I'll try to read something a wee bit more up-to-date soon. This book is great but often quite upsetting. Like the first installment in this series, it's another book written from the viewpoint of someone whose mental scheme of things is slightly "off" from the norm. Also, it's about children, and I don't like children, but I automatically sympathised with the concerns in this book - which goes to show how well realised it is. And it's got ART and synasthesia and stuff in. Woo!
A small but cheering poem by Miss Prism: Orlando Bloom, Orlando Bloom, You tie your hair in ribbons. I'd like to lock you in a room, With forty angry gibbons.

Just a brief post to wish everyone a jolly Bank Holiday Monday. It is sunny here: I hope the weather with you is also fine. I have decided to do no work today, and instead I shall lounge - I think lounge is the best word for it - on the grass outside my house, drinking proper coffee and eating maya gold, which I believe we have already established is urlLink the best thing ever. And to aid my kharma, lately I have added urlLink this to my list of daily bookmarks. It would be especially nice if you did too.

Honest Charlie ain't never sold a duff car in 'is life. ...also, as promised: Out-of-Season Christmas Biscuits 350g plain flour 100g dairy-free marg - you can use butter if you like. 100g soft light brown sugar 1 decently large egg 60g golden syrup 1 tsp baking powder 2 tsp ginger - more if you fancy 2 tsp cinnamon a good grinding of nutmeg if you have any Sieve together the dry ingredients - 300g flour, spices, salt. Rub in the marge/butter which is a good sticky job, then add the sugar. Mix up the egg and the syrup throroughly, then beat into the rest of the biscuit mix, beating it well to get a bit of air in. Roll it out all thin and delicate on a large, flat, CLEAN surface and cut into pussycat shapes - or stars, or circles or what have you. You will also need to make a larger hole than you think in each if you're going to thread them on ribbons, as the dough will expand slightly during cooking. Cook for about 15-20mins at 160 C or gas mark 3. Be warned: this makes TONS of dough, and it's very sticky. If you really can't manhandle it onto a flat surface, add more flour. This recipe is adapted from Nigella's, which was too sticky and didn't taste of enough - I have added more spice and more flour. I should add that, bar the baking powder, you can now get ALL the ingredients required from an Organic shop, and frankly I think you ought to.

Now see here! What could possibly be better than urlLink these , for all biscuit-making shenanigans? You could add little holes and make ginger and cinnamon biccies to hang on your christmas tree, too. You don't know how to make ginger and cinnamon biccies? ...I might dig out the recipe for you tomorrow, then. In other news, urlLink Abbie the Cat is not well. Poor Abbie... It would be nice if you could go and make a donation to his V-E-T funding. Off you go!

This is Charlie cat, who moved in with a fellow known as Down-on-the-Farm after deciding he didn't like all the cats and dogs he was previously living with. He is mean, moody and although less unpredictable than he was, apparently he's still the cat who will want to be stroked until he drools with ecstasy one minute, and the psycho who will actually chase you around the house if you upset him. Charlie also sports a torn right ear from his days as a loony, and keenly anticipates the fullfilment of his plans for World Domination.

You know what monday means, so let's have a big hand for today's GUEST CAT! Today's guest is Diddley, who used to have a sister called Bo. Think about it for a second. She is 12 years old, and her interests include catching frogs and World Domination. Her owner, weevilstepmother, tells us that "once, quite amazingly, I saw [Diddley] strutting proudly up the garden path bearing her prey, looking for all the world like some mad feline Fu Manchu. As she laid it adoringly at my feet, I could see that it was a blackened banana skin fearlessly stalked and captured within the compost heap." By the way, Weevilstepmother's blog is urlLink here!

It strikes me I haven't made you lovely people a wallpaper since those jolly old urlLink Lemurs in Spring. So here is another, not exactly new, but it has done sterling service on my desktop for a while now. I call it urlLink "Last Drink". Just open it, right click and set as wallpaper!
Hooray! Back to normal at last, in fact some might say it's an improvement. What do you think?

Well, I know you are all interested so here is what I got for my birthday: A cheque from Mum (I think I will buy something posh from Reiss) Some cd's from Tomsk Monsoon Vouchers and chocolate from The Mother In Law, yay! A year's subscription to Elle Deco from two of my sisters A peculiar fold-out carrier bag from the other sister - you like bag? Some very jolly socks and an address book from Pamy A pretty necklace from Smellen, a bit like that one of Pamy's that I was always jealous of. :) A reflexology book and a makeup bag from Nay urlLink The Art of Hellboy from Bove A lovely posh tapemeasure from Rogan (I am very pleased with this item) A book and a beautiful handmade card from Pixie Two very dead dismembered baby birdies this morning from the cats. [edit]...and of course a Lemon Kougra cake for urlLink me, Ed and Zee from Mr Seychelles. Hooray for Birthdays! I think that's a decent little haul. *birthday dance* And if you forgot my birthday, that's MY BIRTHDAY, the link to my Amazon wishlist is just urlLink here.

Coo... it's looking a bit funny around these parts lately, isn't it? I'm afraid I had to faff about with the template to make the new Comments section work, so it's all looking very silly and spotty. Do please bear with me!

Today's linky is a bit like that urlLink Gossipyum one from a while back - that's right, it's more hippy organic fairtrade clothing, but this time from urlLink People Tree! It's not bad, not bad at all, and I live in hope that they will one day start producing the sort of chic little items you and I covet, instead of nice t-shirts and uber-basic paisley frocks. In the meantime, have a good look and try to buy something - it will encourage them so.

Morning all! I do hope you all had as lovely a weekend as I - I went to a birthday party and shopped in Lunnon, and surveyed my friend's nice new flat in Limehouse with a view to a little hypothetical redesigning... top darts, overall! But enough about me. It's time to introduce this week's GUEST CAT! This is Nermal, who deigns to share her existence with Jinxx. Jinxx has, rather inspiringly, written us a wee poem about Mighty Nermal: she does not meow she goes 'Map' and she has fur of silk and she likes to stand around as if she's forgotten what she was doing ...and of course, I have it on good authority that she looks forward greatly to the coming era of Cat World Domination.

Before I whisk myself off for another heady weekend of parties and such, I thought I might remind you of these wonderful fellas: urlLink Corky & the Juice Pigs . As the site says, they've split up now, but they were the funniest live act I've ever seen (including Eddie Izzard, no lie) and their two CDs are hilarious. Amongst other classics songs of theirs, you may have heard "The Only Gay Eskimo" and "The Pandas Must Die" - ah, they're great! Have a jolly, chuckling weekend everyone!

...it occurs to me that there is the very slightest off-chance that people reading this will not be aware of urlLink mintimperial.com , which is the site belonging to my dear lovely husband, where he keeps his astoundingly brill animations and stuff. So just in case, there's the linky. They're quite cheery sorts of things, I hope you like 'em. Also I've got stuff in my urlLink ebay shop again, if anyone's interested... *whistles*
Bit late, but here she is: Super-Purrfect! P.S. Ms Shaw, you didn't tell me you address so I can't post your pressie... drop us a line!

Today's Guest Cat is Maxwell Mouse, who lives with Goosewing in a new house. He likes tasty baby blackbirds and does NOT like swimming. He is a ferocious fluffy tiger and has plans to empty all the ponds in Britain on the eve of Cat World Domination.

Right then, to the business of the day! Firstly: sorry to anyone having trouble contacting me. When you click the competition link it will send an email to drphilREMOVEkitten@yahooCAPS.com... which isn't my email address. The REMOVE CAPS bit is supposed to be, well, removed, thus confounding spambots and keeping my inbox streamlined. However it does seem to have confounded a few of my readers too, so I've fixed it and it'll just send normal emails now. I love you all so, I will suffer spam for your sakes - greater love hath no kitten. Anyway, on to more fun stuff - COMPETITION WINNERS! In Third place, we have Mr L. Bucket , who dreamed of becoming "Super Only-Person-To-Enter-Dr-Phils-Competition-Man" because "it's true"... which it wasn't, but hey! I smiled. In Second place, we have Ms A Harris , who suggested becoming Superwoman, but of an unusual kind: I would wear comfy flats shoes and a fancy skirt without showing too much leg, and I would fly around the world helping ladies in need: *foot rubs to those with sore feet... *nail files to desparate women with broken nails... *hair products to those suffering from bad hair days... *my extra special power would be to supply the fluffiest of kittens to those having really all round bad days In the coveted FIRST PLACE , however, is Ms I Shaw , with the following entry: I would be "superpurrfect", dedicating my life to *the destruction of all who overfeed other peoples' cats... *ensuring a continual supply of insects and interesting things for my feline friends to chase and eat... *cleansing the environment of nasty pollutants that harm all the wild creatures that cats just love to chase and play with... *ensuring a plentyful supply of vitamin alcohol, chocolate and lard to sustain all those human pets that cats keep for their amuzement. Humans being far more amuzing (and inclined to feed us pizza) when drunk. ...in the end, it was rather a no-brainer, wasn't it? Cats, booze, pizza and eco-bobbins. A clear winner. I'll photoshop a wee prize tonight, and post it tomorrow - congrats to Ms Shaw!!
I'm about to go for a driving lesson. YIPES. Competition winners will therefor be announced this evening, after I've had a stiff drink and stopped trembling.

Today we are having a music recommendation: urlLink FRANK, by Amy Winehouse. I would strongly advise you to ignore the "customers who bought this record also bought" section, as Katie Melua is god-awful, as is Norah Jones... although I do quite like Norah Jones... anyway Katie Melua is dire, no question. FRANK is great, though - v. smokey jazzy sorts of things, with utterly filthy (and sometimes quite clever) lyrics. Some of the production is quite dance-y and innovative, and most of all, Amy Winehouse has an astounding voice. Judging by her songs, she is also a dangerous lady to cross and a bit of a fruitloop in bed. Hurrah!
Dans l'obscurité, je sens des jeunes encore.

A bit late because of the bank holiday, it's time for your weekly GUEST CAT! This is Porcellina (or Poppy, as she's known). Poppy likes to be upside down and wants to be a car mechanic. An able cheese thief and fly gourmand, she hopes to use her automotive skills in the struggle for world domination. urlLink Remember too, kids, that the SUPER competition still has one week left to run! Just urlLink send an email to let me know what kind of superhero you would be and why, and you could win a prize! In fact you almost certainly will, because no-one's entered yet... *sigh*

Well, yesterday I went to a urlLink Body Shop Party , and a jolly fun time we had too. They're a little keen on the hard-sell but I know you are all strong enough to resist. At present there's a sale on, too. I spent £20 on frilly bits and had to wash myself thoroughly when I got home as I'd covered myself in so many samples I ended up quite sticky. Many thanks to Katie for hosting it!

...yeah, this week's guest cat is late, just 'cos I, um, forgot. Somebody please urlLink give me a job . PLEASE. Right, this is Trouble. She is about 12 weeks old now, and lives with MissPrism and her sister Morgan. She likes climbing, exploring and biting Morgan on the ears. She didn't like falling ten feet from their balcony, but it doesn't seem to have done her any harm. With such acrobatic abilities, the sucess of her quest for World Domination seems assured.

Famous People who have been rightly fond of cats, part 1 of a series which may or may not continue: urlLink click "enter the site", bottom left This film is BEYOND FANTASTIC, and you should see it as soon as it's out over here, which I think is in early September. I will remind you again at the time, don't worry. Thanks to the magic of the nintermawebby, I have seen it already and would recommend you watch out for the scene where Hellboy pauses in his bloodied fight with an infernal demon, to rescue a boxful of miawing kittens. Oh yes.

HOW TO SALES SHOP ALWAYS start with a budget, and expect to go a tiny bit over - not more than 20%, say ALWAYS go to shops you can't normally afford - that's the point, silly ONLY go to H&M or simlar cheap shops if you are going on a summer holiday DO go once in the first week to get the beautiful bits DO go once after a few weeks to get the really, REALLY cheap bits NEVER go more than twice to the same sale! ALWAYS buy your leather & suede in the sales (if you wear skins) DO buy plain things - black trousis, warm jumpers etc. DO NOT try to second guess what will be trendy next season DO allow yourself one - but only one - thing which is simply pretty and warms your heart, however impractical. REMEMBER places like Boots have sales too, so stock up on expensive makeup. ...anyone got any more tips?

This is a dancing kitten what my friend ZOG made for me - he's ace, he's just got a record deal in Germany too so Watch Out Music Fans. Tomorrow I think we shall have less pictorial foolerly and instead one of those Guide To Life thingies I used to do an age ago. I'll have a ponder.

A day late, but here she is! This week's Guest Cat is Socks, who was adopted from the RSPCA with her (late) sister Schmig and lives with Popt_art. Since Schmig's untimely end, Socks (previously somewhat cocky and aloof) has taken on all the nicest traits of her sister. She purrs, sleeps on people's beds and even answers when spoken to. She loves nature and has befriended in her time squirrels and foxes, but is less than enamoured with next doors cross-eyed longhaired cat. Her thoughts on the subject of World Domination you can probably guess. ...and is it just me, or does she have a look of urlLink Paris Hilton about her?

For all those curious as to what I look like, here is a picture of me as a baby, drawn by Down On The Farm: ...I should point out that that's not quite what my haircut or my glasses look like, but for a chap who's never met me it's Frighteningly Accurate, and don't Deeley and Steve look lovely? Hooray! Please note, Guest Cat this week should be up tomorrow - bear with me.

Just a wee thing today: urlLink The Portfolio of Artist Steph Dix , who looks like a jolly nice lady and can draw some really cracking pussycats. Hooray for her! I have a suspicion she also does the "roll up, roll up" strip in the Guardian too, but I can't be sure and I can't find a linky.
Well, I've never seen anyone use a lobster-pick in quite that way before...
Morning! Time for a new wallpaper, I think: urlLink click on this, then right-click and "set as wallpaper". Mitzi will be very happy to see you.

What am I like? I completely forgot about this yesterday - although not one of YOU lot reminded me, I notice. Today's GUEST CAT is Millie, who, like last week's guest Isaac, lives with Lemoncurry and Winston the Rabbit. Millie is a British Blue shorthair and a real snob, sauntering up and down as if she owns the place. She can't be doing with children and hides from most visitors. Her favourite food is cooked chicken (leg - off the bone). She likes to roll over with her mum and dad and pretend to be a teddy bear. She's not very vocal, but when she does speak, she's very loud and bossy. Her favourite TV show is River Cottage with Hugh Fearlessly-Eatsitall. ...well, there's a cat after my own heart, I must say! I'm sure we all wish her luck in her plans for World Domination.

This weekend I went to urlLink a very clever exhibition , and jolly good it was too. If you are not in London, my heart goes out to you. But you could always go to urlLink this beautiful place , which I visted recently too. They're quite good at greenery in Yorkshire. If little else.
Quick quick quick, girls, RUN! urlLink The MYLA Sale has just started, you'd better be fast 'cos let's face it, you could never afford this stuff full price...
Tenterhooks, are we? Gnawing at our hands with excitement, yes? Good good. For TODAY, I shall reveal to you... THE ONE, SINGLE BEST THING ON THE INTERNET. urlLink ->The Kitten Band.

CONGRATULATIONS TO MR BOVINE - he has a fancy new job as an animator for a clever website (not sure if I'm allowed to say whose) and he is GREAT. See, urlLink here and urlLink here. And now on to the business of the day. IN SECOND PLACE: The answer to an important question... urlLink Where can you see Lions? Weebl is a very talented chappy who made those jolly Wobbl & Bob cartoons on MTV, as well as the infamous "badger badger badger badger" viral and many other peculiar things. He likes Japanese food and is quite shy until you get him a bit tiddled. Have a look around his site - there's a really clever hiphop spider and a lovely Christmas song in there somewhere.

...I hope you hadn't forgotten our theme for the next three days? Jolly good. IN THIRD PLACE : urlLink The Orky Puppy Page! (also includes kittens) A more sophisticated version is here: urlLink Orktastic but it's animated so you can't stop and go "aaawwwwwwwwww!" quite as effectively.

Today's GUEST CAT is Isaac, who lives with Lemoncurry the human, Millie the Cat and Winston the Rabbit. Here he is in his bath, which as you can see he does not mind a bit. Lemoncurry says: "...he does have a naughty habbit of knocking EVERY glass over he can find to see what is in it. He also likes to 'investigate' the neighbourhood - he goes out with us on a lead as hes a house cat - but is very naive about the 'outside' world - and consequently tries to talk to ANY other animals - big or small." He is also very loyal and loving, which I imagine makes a good cover for his plans for World Domination. What an appallingly cute animal he is. It quite brings a tear to the eye. Tune in again tomorrow, when I shall commence this useful three-part series:

Now, I don't know how many of my lady readers out there are midnight of hair and moonlit of complexion, like me, but if you are: may I say you need to get your hands on some of urlLink THIS. I finally got around to chemically dissolving my moustache* last night and this morning, by God, I look all young and fresh and jolly in an indefinable yet significant sort of way. * Don't lie, I know you have one too.

It's Friday at last, so tonight I expect you all to get your gladrags on and go out and party. Wave your hands in the ayer, etc. This guy's already waiting for you, so hurry up if you want to catch him before he's had one too many - they serve the martinis very strong at that place...

I don't know if you have heard of the fillums of urlLink Hayao Miyazaki (Studio Ghibli) , but let me tell you they are ace, and don't be put off because they're furrin. There was a recent release of urlLink Spirited Away in a rather well-dubbed version which was at cinemas, so you might've seen that, or heard of I think their 2nd most famous one, urlLink My Neighbour Totoro which starts off a little annoying and winds up BEYOND peculiar - it has a catbus and all sorts. Both of these are complex, beautiful films that knock spots off most Disney output, and I really do urge you to seek 'em out. Boys will like them too. But the one I was going to mention today was urlLink Laputa, Castle in the Sky which is a bit steampunk, and had moderately famous Americans to do the voiceovers. The oddest bit about watching this film though was that the urlLink Evil General Muska is the very image of my urlLink ex , except without the homicidal manic tendencies. No, honest.
How about this: urlLink A News Story so happy it reads almost like fiction. ...isn't that something wonderful? Doesn't it give you hope? Hooray!!

ARRGH! AAAARRRGH!! AAAAAARRRRGH!!! It's all going utterly pear-shaped around here... There was no post on Friday, I promised MissPrism a Trouble photoshop that never materialised, and worst of all: I've lost her web page somehow so I can't get all the info on Morgan that she deserves. However, from memory: This week's GUEST CAT is Morgan. She is Trouble's sister, a little smaller and better behaved. Morgan likes killing her mousie and being groomed and cuddled. Her plans for the future include World Domination and not falling off the balcony, and she has mastered the exquisitely distainful Cat Face very early, as you can see: I am really sorry for all the disruption, and I'm afraid it's not going to get better soon, either, as I'm on holiday from the end of this week. Please keep us on your bookmarks, normal service will be resumed before the end of the month.
